means: 胚教，铭记（动物生命早期即起作用的一种学习机能）

word_mean: 印刻铭记：在生命的早期关键阶段，接触到适当的刺激后，很快地学到物种特异的行为型式
又称“印痕”。发生在动物个体发育早期阶段的一种不可逆转的学习类型，很多幼小动物在其出世的早期阶段不仅会对其遇到的任何移动着的物体产生依附性，而且以后还会对这一物体表现出性行为和社会行为。

sentence.Network_en: He gathered her to himself, imprinting kisses upon her lips and cheeks.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把她抱过来, 吻着她的嘴唇和面颊.

sentence.Network_en: It'seems likely that imprinting is an extreme case of conditioning.
sentence.Network_cn: 看来似乎铭记是适应的一种极端的情况.

sentence.Network_en: They may have dreams, but the " imprinting " keeps pulling them back.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们可能有梦想, 但 “ 烙印 ” 让他们止步不前.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 印记（imprinting）的机制是一种超基因（epigenetic）遗传机制，利用这个机制可以在不改变基因序列的情形下，控制基因的开启和 …
n“印刻” (imprinting)是指刚获得生命不久的小动物追逐它们最初看到的能活动的生物，并对其产生依恋之情的现象。n个体在这时刻所 …

同问什么是印记基因(imprinted gene)？ 2005-12-05 16:31 relativist | 分类：理工学科什么是印记基因(imprinted gene)？

entry.def: If something leaves an imprint on a place or on your mind, it has a strong and lasting effect on it.

example.ex: The city bears the imprint of Japanese investment...
example.tran: 该市带有日本投资的深刻印记。

example.ex: Both King and Gandhi were tremendously brave men whose unique form of courage left a lasting imprint on their nations' histories.
example.tran: 金和甘地都是勇敢无畏的人,他们独一无二的勇气在他们各自国家的历史上留下了深远影响。

entry.def: When something is imprinted on your memory, it is firmly fixed in your memory so that you will not forget it.

example.ex: The skyline of domes and minarets was imprinted on my memory...
example.tran: 天空中穹顶与尖塔的轮廓深深刻在了我的记忆中。

example.ex: He repeated the names, as if to imprint them in his mind...
example.tran: 他一遍遍重复着那些名字,仿佛要把它们铭刻在心里。

entry.def: An imprint is a mark or outline made by the pressure of one object on another.

example.ex: The ground still bore the imprints of their feet.
example.tran: 地面上仍然留有他们的脚印。

entry.def: If a surface is imprinted with a mark or design, that mark or design is printed on the surface or pressed into it.

example.ex: Stationery can be imprinted with your message or logo...
example.tran: 可以把你的信息或标志印在信纸上。

example.ex: They also left a card, imprinted with the name Sean Lynch.
example.tran: 他们还留下了一张名片,上面印着肖恩·林奇的名字。

means.word_mean: 1. a learning process in early life whereby species specific patterns of behavior are established

auth_sentence.content: Reptiles don't undergo genomic imprinting, so mating isn't required for mothers to develop their young but it is not known why.
auth_sentence.res_content: Reptiles don't undergo genomic imprinting, so mating isn't required for mothers to develop their young but it is not known why.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Reptiles don't undergo genomic imprinting, so mating isn't required for mothers to develop their young but it is not known why.

auth_sentence.content: This seems to be a matter of sexual imprinting rather than a simple preference for others who resemble us.
auth_sentence.res_content: This seems to be a matter of sexual imprinting rather than a simple preference for others who resemble us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This seems to be a matter of sexual imprinting rather than a simple preference for others who resemble us.

auth_sentence.content: The lights are there, imprinting the dark with holiday cheer, and then are not.
auth_sentence.res_content: The lights are there, imprinting the dark with holiday cheer, and then are not.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The lights are there, imprinting the dark with holiday cheer, and then are not.
